name: Caracoles Dataset
description: For each subplot we collected community abundance at peak flowering, within guild interaction observations (flower production related to the neighbourhood), and weekly higher trophic information.

spatialCoverage.name: Caracoles Ranch (2680 ha), an annual grassland system located in Doñana National Park, southwest Spain. The plant community is dominated by annuals from the Poaceae, Asteraceae and Chenopodaceae families, with no perennial species present. The climate is Mediterranean, with mild winters and an average 50-year annual rainfall of 550–570 mm with high interannual oscillations. Soils are sodic saline (electric conductivity > 4 dS/m and pH < 8.5).

variableMeasured.name: raw_species_id
variableMeasured.description: id of floral visitor observed, can be a nickname

variableMeasured.name: number_visits
variableMeasured.description: number of flowers visited

variableMeasured.name: jar
variableMeasured.description: specify if a specimen was collected for detailed identification

variableMeasured.name: plant
variableMeasured.description: code of the plant species with which the floral visitor interacted with

variableMeasured.description: time of observation

variableMeasured.description: people who observed the interaction

variableMeasured.name: weather

variableMeasured.name: id_final
variableMeasured.description: final id after identification and check with past record, same as species_id

variableMeasured.name: type
variableMeasured.description: type of insect, either floral visitor or/and herbivore such as beetle

variableMeasured.name: group

variableMeasured.name: order

variableMeasured.name: species

variableMeasured.name: species_id
variableMeasured.description: condensed species id e.g., Apis_mellifera, to the highest level of detail possible, minimum is the order

variableMeasured.name: stage
variableMeasured.description: stage of the individual e.g., butterfly, larvae (if necessary)

variableMeasured.name: morpho_sp
variableMeasured.description: name relataed to it appearance e.g., white_moth (if available)

variableMeasured.name: nickname
variableMeasured.description: nickname commonly used on the field (if necessary)

variableMeasured.name: order
variableMeasured.description: number of the row

variableMeasured.name: complexity
variableMeasured.description: levels of grouping complexity i.e., species, family or functional group

variableMeasured.name: grouping
variableMeasured.description: id of the species

variableMeasured.name: HTL
variableMeasured.description: higher trophic level it belong to, either floral visitor or herbivore

variableMeasured.name: YesNo
variableMeasured.description: determine it inclusion in the model yes, no or maybe

variableMeasured.description: any comments about the observation
